heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Food Safety Authority of Ireland Act
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Food Safety Authority of Ireland Act 

1998 (Amendment of First Schedule) Order 2021.

title: and the Health (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) (No. 3) Order 2020 (S.I.
heading: In this Order—
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order— 

“Act” means the Food Safety Authority of Ireland Act 1998 (No. 29 of 1998); 

“Order of 2020” means the Food Safety Authority of Ireland Act 1998 
(Amendment of First Schedule) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 173 of 2020).
text_norm: 2 order-- act mean food safety authority ireland act 1998 (no 29 1998) order 2020 mean food safety authority ireland act 1998 (amendment first schedule) order 2020 (s.i no 173 2020)

title: and the Health (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) (No. 3) Order 2020 (S.I.
heading: 3. Part II (as amended by Article 3 of the Order of 2020) of the First
text_raw:
3. Part II (as amended by Article 3 of the Order of 2020) of the First 

Schedule to the Act is amended— 

(a) by deleting the following statutory instruments: 

“European Communities (Importation of Animals and Animal 
Products from Third Countries) Regulations 1994 (S.I. No. 255 
of 1994)”; 

“European Communities (Veterinary Checks on Products 
Imported from Third Countries) Regulations 2000 (S.I. No. 292 
of 2000)”; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 6th April, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [152] 3 

“European Communities (Veterinary Checks on Fish and 
Fishery Products Imported from Third Countries) Regulations 
2003 (S.I. No. 548 of 2003)”; and 

“European Communities (Import of Personal Consignments of 
Products of Animal Origin) Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 374 of 
2012).”, and 

(b) by inserting after “Radiological Protection Act 1991 (Ionising 
Radiation) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 30 of 2019).” the 
following statutory instruments: 

“Sea-Fisheries (Community Control System) Regulations 2016 
(S.I. No. 54 of 2016). 

European Union (Persistent Organic Pollutants) Regulations 
2020 (S.I. No. 146 of 2020). 

European Union (Imports of Animals and Animal Products 
from Third Countries) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 656 of 
2020).”.

title: and the Health (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) (No. 3) Order 2020 (S.I.
heading: 4. Part III (as amended by Article 4 of the Order of 2020) of the First
text_raw:
4. Part III (as amended by Article 4 of the Order of 2020) of the First 

Schedule to the Act is amended— 

(a) by deleting the following Regulations: 

“Council Regulation (EC) No. 733/2008 of 15 July 2008 on 
the conditions governing imports of agricultural products 
originating in third countries following the accident at the 
Chernobyl nuclear power station.”; 

“Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1251/2008 of 12 December 
2008 implementing Council Directive 2006/88/EC as regards 
conditions and certification requirements for the placing on the 
market and the import into the Community of aquaculture

species (insofar as it pertains to food).”;

2009 establishing a Community control system for ensuring

title: and the Health (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) (No. 3) Order 2020 (S.I.
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

This Order amends the First Schedule to the Food Safety Authority of Ireland 
Act 1998. 

This Order may be cited as the Food Safety Authority of Ireland Act 1998 
(Amendment of First Schedule) Order 2021. 

For ease of reference, a list of all food legislation and official agencies, as 
contained in the First and Second Schedules to the Food Safety Authority of 
Ireland Act 1998, as well as a list of Regulations made under the European 
Communities Act 1972 and deemed to be food legislation for the purposes of 
the Food Safety Authority of Ireland Act 1998, and Regulations made under 
the Health Act 1947 as amended by section 25 of the Irish Medicines Board 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2006, can be found on the website www.fsai.ie 
(https://www.fsai.ie/legislation/fsai_act_related.html). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [152] 25

ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR
